cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."
—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

rulings.text: Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Zhalfirin Crusader
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zhalfirin Crusader this turn is dealt to any target instead.
cards.flavor:
"War is the crucible of leadership."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: Redirect 1 damage from Zhalfirin Crusader to target creature or player.

cards.name: Army Ants
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"Do not underestimate the power of many against one."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Breathstealer's Crypt
cards.text: If a player would draw a card, instead they draw a card and reveal it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless they pay 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."
—Telim'Tor
cards.originalText: Whenever any player draws a card, he or she reveals that card. If the card is a creature card, that player pays 3 life or discards the card.

cards.name: Corrosion
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
When Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.

rulings.text: It does count rust counters put on artifacts by other Corrosion cards. This means that having more than one of these can result in fast destruction of artifacts.
In multiplayer games, you can choose a new target player each upkeep.

Only puts rust counters on artifacts your opponents control, but destroys all artifacts with rust counters on them, even your own. When it leaves the battlefield, it removes all rust counters, not just those that happen to be on artifacts.

cards.name: Femeref Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever an enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing."
—"The Enchantress," Femeref tale

rulings.text: If it goes to the graveyard, its ability will not trigger because of any Auras on herself unless those Auras are being destroyed by the same effect that is destroying the Enchantress. This is because those Auras are not put into the graveyard until after she is in the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Whenever an enchantment is put into any graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Firestorm Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Cumulative upkeep {U}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
cards.flavor:
"If it can scar the sky with fire, do not share its destination."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
Cumulative upkeep {U}{R}

cards.name: Guiding Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.
cards.flavor:
"Retainer of eternal Sun! Life flash again upon thy wings."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on the top of that player's library.

cards.name: Mundungu
cards.text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants."
—Tuwile, mundungu of Aku
cards.originalText: {T}: Counter target spell unless that spell's caster pays an additional {1} and 1 life. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Pygmy Hippo
cards.text: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land they control and lose all unspent mana. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your next main phase this turn, you add an amount of {C} equal to the amount of mana that player lost this way.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Pygmy Hippo attacks and is not blocked, you may choose to have it deal no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player draws all mana from his or her lands and then his or her mana pool is emptied. After combat, add an equal amount of colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Righteous War
cards.text:
White creatures you control have protection from black.
Black creatures you control have protection from white.
cards.flavor:
"This is a war without neutrality."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText:
All white creatures you control gain protection from black.
All black creatures you control gain protection from white.

cards.name: Scalebane's Elite
cards.text: Protection from black
cards.flavor:
"With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara!"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Protection from black

cards.name: Simoon
cards.text: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Squandered Resources
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Add one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.
cards.flavor:
"He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: Can sacrifice a land which can't produce mana, but you don't get any mana from this ability.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Suleiman's Legacy
cards.text:
When Suleiman's Legacy enters the battlefield, destroy all Djinns and Efreets. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a Djinn or Efreet enters the battlefield, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.

rulings.text: Does nothing to Djinns or Efreets that phase in while it is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
When Suleiman's Legacy comes into play, bury all Djinns and Efreets.
Whenever a Djinn or Efreet comes into play, bury it.

cards.name: Tempest Drake
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
"Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Tempest Drake to tap.

cards.name: Viashivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn
{G}: +0/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Coral Atoll
cards.text:
Coral Atoll enters the battlefield tapped.
When Coral Atoll enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{U}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

cards.originalText:
Coral Atoll comes into play tapped. 
When Coral Atoll comes into play, return an untapped island you control to owner's hand or bury Coral Atoll.
{T}: Add {U} and one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dormant Volcano
cards.text:
Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{R}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

cards.originalText:
Dormant Volcano comes into play tapped. 
When Dormant Volcano comes into play, return an untapped mountain you control to owner's hand or bury Dormant Volcano.
{T}: Add {R} and one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Everglades
cards.text:
Everglades enters the battlefield tapped.
When Everglades enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Swamp you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{B}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

cards.originalText:
Everglades comes into play tapped.
When Everglades comes into play, return an untapped swamp you control to owner's hand or bury Everglades.
{T}: Add {B} and one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Griffin Canyon
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Untap target Griffin. If it's a creature, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?"
—The One Thousand Questions

rulings.text: This can target an already untapped Griffin, and gives the bonus regardless.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Untap target Griffin. That Griffin gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Jungle Basin
cards.text:
Jungle Basin enters the battlefield tapped.
When Jungle Basin enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Forest you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{G}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

cards.originalText:
Jungle Basin comes into play tapped. 
When Jungle Basin comes into play, return an untapped forest you control to owner's hand or bury Jungle Basin.
{T}: Add {G} and one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Karoo
cards.text:
Karoo enters the battlefield tapped.
When Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{W}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

cards.originalText:
Karoo comes into play tapped.
When Karoo comes into play, return an untapped plains you control to owner's hand or bury Karoo.
{T}: Add {W} and one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Quicksand
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Undiscovered Paradise
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

rulings.text: It will return even if some effect prevents you from untapping it. The ability is not replacing the untapping of the land in any way.
Only returns to owner's hand if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of its controller's next untap.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. At the beginning of your next untap phase, return Undiscovered Paradise to owner's hand.

cards.name: Barrin
cards.text: Sacrifice a permanent: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: An old and powerful wizard living on the mysterious isle of Tolaria, Barrin is the teacher who trained the young Ertai. He is also Hanna's father, but for reasons known only to the two of them neither acknowledges the other—or their strained relationship.
cards.originalText: You may sacrifice a permanent to return any creature to its owner's hand. Play this ability as an instant.

cards.name: Crovax
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals damage to a creature or player, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: How does one escape a curse? For Crovax, a wealthy noble, the answer may lie in joining the crew of the Weatherlight as they seek to rescue their abducted captain Sisay.  Secretly, he hopes in his journeys to find Selenia, the angelic being who abandoned him and his family years ago.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures damages any creature or player, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ertai
cards.text: Creatures you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: After serving his apprenticeship under Barrin of Tolaria, Ertai graced the Weatherlight crew with his presence as the ship's "resident" wizard. He realizes that few recognize his greatness—but then how could they, when they lack his insight and wisdom?
cards.originalText: Your creatures can't be the target of your opponents' spells or abilities.

cards.name: Gerrard
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
cards.flavor: Soldier. Adventurer. Heir to the Legacy. Gerrard has, over the years, traveled much of Dominaria in search of fortune and glory. Now, after serving nobly in the Benalish army, he has returned to the Weatherlight to serve as captain in Sisay's absence and to take up the battle against the Lord of the Wastes.
cards.originalText: During your draw phase, draw an additional card.

cards.name: Greven il-Vec
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: As a ruthless leader for Volrath, Greven il-Vec serves his lord by commanding the flying ship Predator. Greven has attained his powerful rank through a series of underhanded schemes and assassinations, the majority of which were blessed by Volrath himself.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures damages any creature, bury the damaged creature.

cards.name: Hanna
cards.text: Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Educated in Argive and highly knowledgeable in the field of artifacts, this expert navigator of the Weatherlight believes that scholarship does not necessarily lead to understanding. Her diligence in pursuing both is her greatest asset.
cards.originalText: Your spells cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Karn
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact you control is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Both part of the Legacy and an individual in his own right, the silver golem Karn is haunted by a single, terrible incident: while serving to protect the young Gerrard, Karn accidentally took the life of another. Wakened from years spent as a statue, the golem has vowed to never kill again as he rejoins Gerrard.
cards.originalText: Each of your noncreature artifacts is also an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its total casting cost.

cards.name: Maraxus
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: Too chaotic for even the other warlords of Keld, Maraxus has devoted himself to serving as a hired killer for the sinister Volrath. A man fond of his work, he's more than willing to put in those extra hours needed to perfect his craft.
cards.originalText: Your creatures get +1/+0.

cards.name: Mirri
cards.text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.
cards.flavor: Mirri and Gerrard have been the best of friends since they trained together under the maro-sorcerer Multani. A fierce and agile warrior, she rejoined Gerrard aboard the Weatherlight as his unofficial first mate shortly after he assumed command of the flying ship.
cards.originalText: Each of your basic lands may be tapped to produce any color of mana instead of its normal type.

cards.name: Orim
cards.text: Creatures you control have reach.
cards.flavor: Trained in the Samite arts, Orim serves as the healer aboard the Weatherlight. She is quick with languages and was educated at the same Argivian university as Hanna. A student by nature, Orim keeps a diary of all her new discoveries—both physical and spiritual—during her travels.
cards.originalText: Your creatures can block as though they had flying.

cards.name: Selenia
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance.
cards.flavor: Once a guardian of Crovax's estate, Selenia was freed from her magical bindings by the wealthy noble. Instead of remaining at his side, the angel chose to venture out into the world. For reasons unknown to Crovax, Selenia now serves the evil Volrath in his home realm of Rath.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause your creatures to tap.

cards.name: Sisay
cards.text: Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
cards.flavor: While captain of the Weatherlight, Sisay undertook a quest for the Legacy, a collection of artifacts needed to defeat the Lord of the Wastes. She continued this quest even when Gerrard, heir to the Legacy, chose to abandon it. Sisay is devoted to the cause of good at whatever price.
cards.originalText: Whenever you tap a land for mana, it produces one additional mana of the same type.

cards.name: Squee
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor: The smartest—and only—goblin cabin boy aboard the Weatherlight, Squee has learned that intelligence and common sense are very different things. This matters little, however, since he has neither. Fortunately, he doesn't know what he's missing.
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands face up.

cards.name: Starke
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw an additional card. If you do, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Starke believes in situational ethics—the situation determines the ethics. He's switched sides so often that he has become everyone's ally yet no one's friend. This former merchant of Rath accompanies the Weatherlight crew on their journey to his home world.
cards.originalText: During your draw phase, you may draw an additional card and then put any card in your hand on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Tahngarth
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste.
cards.flavor: Tahngarth, first mate of the Weatherlight under Sisay, knows that there are really only two forms of life: the ugly ones and the minotaurs. A narcissist, he considers the condition of his hide as important as the accuracy of his blade.
cards.originalText: Your creatures are unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Volrath
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may put it on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The son of Gerrard's surrogate father, Sidar Kondo, Volrath stole Gerrard's Legacy and rose to power selling it off piece by piece. Now, he is an evincar, or agent, of the Lord of the Wastes. Armed with exceptional magical powers, he plots to conquer the entire multiverse.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures is put into your graveyard from play, you may put that creature on top of your library.

cards.name: Eladamri
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control is dealt to you instead.
cards.flavor: Proud, shrewd, and charismatic, Eladamri has a commitment to his people that is absolute. The guerilla war he wages against Volrath has convinced him that the only way to liberate the Skyshroud elves is to lead all Rath's refugees to freedom. So be it.
cards.originalText: You may redirect to yourself any amount of damage dealt to creatures you control.

cards.name: Oracle
cards.text: {0}: Untap target attacking creature you control and remove it from combat.
cards.flavor: Known simply by her title, Oracle uses her gift of prophecy to aid her people. She believes Gerrard to be the Korvecdal, the one who will unite the people of Rath against Volrath's tyranny. Her only doubt is whether she will be strong enough to guide him to his destiny.
cards.originalText: You may untap any attacking creatures you control and remove them from combat.

cards.name: Lyna
cards.text: Creatures you control have shadow. (They can block and be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: One of the few Soltari who can cross the shadow barrier, Lyna serves as an emissary to the outside world. A quick thinker and convincing speaker, she does whatever she can to lead her people out of the shadows and into substance.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control gain shadow. (Those creatures can block and be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)

cards.name: Sliver Queen, Brood Mother
cards.text: {3}: Create a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token.
cards.flavor: Though long held captive beneath Volrath's stronghold, the sliver queen is actually freer than most of Rath's denizens. Her maternal instincts always take precedence—even when they conflict with the evincar's agenda—and through her numerous litters, she ranges across all of Rath.
cards.originalText: {3}: Put a Sliver token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 colorless creature.

cards.name: Takara
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Takara deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Takara banishes the shadow of her father's ignoble reputation through the dedication, plain speaking, and swift action of a warrior. By refusing Starke's path of self-interest and opportunism, she has learned what he never will know: the value of sacrifice for a worthy cause.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Takara deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Rofellos
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Gerrard's longtime friend and fellow student under the maro-sorcerer Multani, Rofellos is an excellent warrior and excellent company. Though adept at both magic and swordplay, he's far more comfortable with a flagon in his hand and a good companion at his side.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Multani
cards.text: Creatures you control get +X/+0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: In mentoring apprentice mages, the forest spirit Multani teaches each to respect nature while making use of its gifts. Multani taught Gerrard, Mirri, and Rofellos to hone their spellcasting in tandem with more physical disciplines so that both would be improved.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +X/+0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Sidar Kondo
cards.text: {3}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Kondo served as guardian to the infant Gerrard and raised him alongside his own son, Vuel. He taught both boys to be strong and to lead, but whereas Gerrard became a champion of honor, Vuel's bitterness led him to become an equally devastating force of malice.
cards.originalText: {3}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Urza
cards.text: {3}: Urza deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: An artificer of unparalleled renown, Urza was a powerful cipher even before he was able to planeswalk. Seeing the world as a large, integrated machine is his greatest strength and weakness, enabling him to solve almost any problem but blinding him to his solutions' effects on others.
cards.originalText: {3}: Urza deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Mishra
cards.text: If a creature you control would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.
cards.flavor: Both complement and antithesis to his older brother Urza, Mishra also mastered the intricacies of artifice. It was Mishra's strength that first gave rise to the massive Phyrexian war engines on Dominaria, and it was his weakness that pushed him, Urza, and Dominaria itself to the point of annihilation.
cards.originalText: Double all damage dealt by creatures you control.

cards.name: Tawnos
cards.text: You may cast artifact, creature, and enchantment spells as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: Tawnos brings a childlike wonder and an inherent skill to Urza's studio and bridges the wizardry of the workshop with the grandeur of the royal court. His speed and flexibility quickly earned him promotion from apprentice to master artificer.
cards.originalText: You may play artifact, creature, and enchantment spells any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Ashnod
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
cards.flavor: Ashnod served as Mishra's confidante while he led Fallaji weapons development before the Brothers' War. Whereas Mishra works in metals and stone, however, Ashnod works in living flesh. She sees all living things as prototype machines; her "improvements" to them make her as feared by allies as by enemies.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature successfully damages you, destroy it.

cards.name: Gix
cards.text: {3}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Through ruthlessness and raw ambition, Gix rose through the Phyrexian regime to the exalted rank of praetor. Even while overseeing many of Phyrexia's most important undertakings, Gix continues his own quest for supremacy . . . for in Phyrexia, the weak become fodder for the strong.
cards.originalText: {3}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Xantcha
cards.text: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: A Phyrexian "sleeper agent," Xantcha has developed an inviolate sense of self. This aberration earned her a death sentence, but she was rescued by Urza and joined his crusade. Her Phyrexian credo of "Waste not, want not" has helped Urza more than even he comprehends.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Serra
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor: Named for a benevolent goddess at birth, Serra fulfilled the prophecy of that goddess's coming. As a planeswalker, she embodies white mana and helps whole civilizations develop while both directly and indirectly inspiring countless individuals to be steadfast and strong in the service of light.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Titania
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.flavor: Voice of the Argoth forest, defender of its creatures, and enforcer of its laws, Titania is literally an aspect of the forest itself. Her power and her very existence are linked to the land: when the forest is healthy, Titania is ascendant. When Argoth suffers, Titania also bleeds.
cards.originalText: You may play an additional land each of your turns.

cards.name: Serra Angel Avatar
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Serra Angel Avatar
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief Avatar
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief Avatar
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Stalking Tiger Avatar
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: MI Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise Avatar
cards.text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.
cards.originalText: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Fallen Angel Avatar
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: 2004 Holiday Event Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu Avatar
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number chosen at random from 0 to 4.
cards.flavor: Awarded in celebration of the second birthday of Magic Online
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number chosen at random from 0 to 4.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer Avatar
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Ocassionally, members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldy pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer Avatar
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn Avatar
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Grinning Demon Avatar
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.

cards.name: Phage the Untouchable Avatar
cards.text:
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, destroy that creature.
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever target creature you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy the damaged creature.
cards.flavor: LGN Participation Avatar
cards.originalText:
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, destroy that creature.
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever target creature you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy the damaged creature.

cards.name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath Avatar
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gains two abilities chosen at random from flying, first strike, trample, haste, protection from black, protection from red, and vigilance.
cards.flavor: "Chuck's Virtual Party" avatar (2003)
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gains two of the following abilities chosen at random: flying, first strike, trample, haste, protection from black, protection from red, and vigilance.

cards.name: Karona, False God Avatar
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, exchange control of a permanent you control chosen at random and a permanent target opponent controls chosen at random.
cards.flavor: SCG Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, exchange control of a permanent you control chosen at random and a permanent target opponent controls chosen at random.

cards.name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys Avatar
cards.text:
Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: Awarded in celebration of the first birthday of Magic Online
cards.originalText:
Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

cards.name: Elvish Champion Avatar
cards.text: You begin the game with a 1/1 green Elf creature token on the battlefield. It has "{T}: Add {G}."
cards.flavor: 8ED Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: You begin the game with a 1/1 green Elf creature token on the battlefield that has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."

cards.name: Royal Assassin Avatar
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: 8ED Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Bosh, Iron Golem Avatar
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice an artifact with converted mana cost X: Bosh, Iron Golem Avatar deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: MRD Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: {X}, Sacrifice an artifact with converted mana cost X: Bosh, Iron Golem deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Platinum Angel Avatar
cards.text: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.
cards.originalText: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

cards.name: Viridian Zealot Avatar
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Search your library for a card with the same name as the sacrificed creature, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: DST Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Search your library for a card with the same name as the sacrificed creature, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails Avatar

cards.name: Seshiro the Anointed Avatar
cards.text: At the beginning of the game, choose a creature type. Creatures you control, creature spells you control, and creature cards you own in any zone other than the battlefield or the stack have the chosen type in addition to their other types.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of the game, choose a creature type. Creatures you control, creature spells you control, and creature cards you own in any zone other than  the battlefield or the stack have the chosen type in addition to their other types.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, choose a creature card at random from your library, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Frenetic Efreet Avatar
cards.text:
Each permanent you control has phasing. (It phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
At the beginning of your end step, flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor: MI Prize Avatar
cards.originalText:
Permanents you control have phasing.
At the beginning of your end step, flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Nekrataal Avatar

cards.name: Chronatog Avatar
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{0}: Draw three cards. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

You have no maximum hand size.
{0}: Draw three cards. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch Avatar
cards.text:
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
Hellbent — At the beginning of your end step, if you have no cards in hand, each of your opponents discards a card.
cards.flavor: DIS Prize Avatar
cards.originalText:
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
Hellbent — At the beginning of your end step, if you have no cards in hand, each of your opponents discards a card.

cards.name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary Avatar
cards.text: {X}, Discard a card: Create a token that's a copy of a creature card with converted mana cost X chosen at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.
cards.flavor: DIS Participation Avatar
cards.originalText: {X}, Discard a card: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature card with converted mana cost X chosen at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.
